SEARCH
Package HdbManager

Class HdbManager

java.lang.Object
Users.User
HdbManager.HdbManager
public class HdbManager extends User
Represents an HDB Manager, which is a specialized user who manages a specific project.

  • Nested Class Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • HdbManager

      public HdbManager(String name, String nric, int age, User.MaritalStatus maritalStatus, String password, Project managedProject)
      Constructs an HDB Manager with a name, NRIC, age, marital status, password, and a managed project.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the manager.
      nric - The NRIC of the manager.
      age - The age of the manager.
      maritalStatus - The marital status of the manager.
      password - The password for the manager's account.
      managedProject - The project that the manager is assigned to.

  • Method Details

      Gets the unique ID of the manager.
      Returns:
      The manager's unique ID.

    • getManagedProject

      public Project getManagedProject()
      Gets the project managed by the manager.
      Returns:
      The managed project, or null if no project is assigned.

    • getManagedProjectName

      public String getManagedProjectName()
      Gets the name of the project managed by the manager.
      Returns:
      The name of the managed project, or null if no project is assigned.

    • toString

      Overrides:
      toString in class User

    • setManagedProject

      public void setManagedProject(Project managedProject)
      Sets the project managed by the manager.
      Parameters:
      managedProject - The project to be assigned to the manager.

    • canManage

      public boolean canManage(Project project)
      Determines whether the manager can manage a given project. A manager can manage a new project if they are not already managing another project, or if the current managed project's close date is before the new project's open date.
      Parameters:
      project - The project to check.
      Returns:
      True if the manager can manage the project, otherwise false.
